results:
Based on the search results, I found information about Karolina Korcz's dissertation on "Mistrz i Małgorzata" (Master and Margarita) by Mikhail Bulgakov at Adam Mickiewicz University in Poznań. Here's what I found:

Karolina Korcz wrote her doctoral dissertation titled "Mistrz i Małgorzata Michaiła Bułhakowa w Polsce w latach 1969-1989" (Master and Margarita by Mikhail Bulgakov in Poland in the years 1969-1989) at Adam Mickiewicz University in Poznań. 

This dissertation was later published as a book titled "Cień Wolanda nad PRL. 'Mistrz i Małgorzata' Michaiła Bułhakowa w Polsce w latach 1969–1989. Obecność. Recepcja. Odzew" (The Shadow of Woland over PRL. "Master and Margarita" by Mikhail Bulgakov in Poland in the years 1969–1989. Presence. Reception. Response) published in Poznań in 2019.

Dr. Karolina Korcz's research interests focus on the conditions and ways of functioning of Mikhail Bulgakov's most famous novel in the reading circulation in Poland, the specificity of reception, and the value of this work for Polish culture.

The work has been praised as filling an important gap in Polish literary studies, being the first comprehensive study to examine the reception of the novel in relation to Polish socio-cultural life, and is considered significant both in Polish and foreign Polish studies.

The search results indicate this was indeed a doctoral dissertation from Adam Mickiewicz University in Poznań, though the exact year appears to be slightly different from what you searched for - the published book came out in 2019, which may have been when the dissertation was completed or published.
